name: Conformalizer Change List
summary: Learn about .CONFORM files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Conformalizer was an audio post-production program that allowed audio producers to map audio tracks, including dialogue, music, and sound effect tracks, to a picture cut (of a film or TV show). When Conformalizer mapped audio to a picture cut, it recorded the changes it made to the audio and picture cut in a CONFORM file. Doing so allowed producers to revert to previous versions of their project's audio and picture cut if needed.
NOTE: Conformalizer was originally published by Maggot Software, before being acquired by The Cargo Cult. The Cargo Cult has since replaced Conformalizer with Matchbox.

instructions: CONFORM files are not meant to be opened by users. The Cargo Cult Conformalizer loads and uses CONFORM files automatically as needed.
